messages: d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:32): Hello everyone
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:32): I am running vim - but I cant seem to get it to accept my backspace key
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:32): How did I expect that :)
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:32): LeoNerd: You sent me here :)
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:32): I can insert stuff - and delete stuff I inserted
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:32): but I cannot delete stuff already there
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:32): any ideas?
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:33): Yes. Read the help page I suggested
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:33): That will explain
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:34): oh I didn't know that was an actual page
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:34): :he something  searches for the help on that thing.
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:34): Lots of suggestions we give here start with that
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:35): Standard docs can explain much better than I can offhand from memory
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:38): Ok - I read that file
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:38): says to go to |:fixdel|
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:38): That command didn't work - probably because I typed it wrong
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:40): The bars are just there for vim to parse the tags properly
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:41): If you have mouse support you can click it
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:43): Ok - well I still can't delete text that has been saved already
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:43): i wonder why that is
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:43): but anyway
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:44): At least I can add new text
4969e383a78d3407b54160eb0de4b90b (03:44): Read the help about the bs option, and it will tell you why
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:46): I read that
d7f17e765d6d1615a786504fec42fed2 (03:46): I changed the backspace option to 2
b4e3daec418edfcea395a7f72f63a812 (04:04): I have changed my terminal to urxvt and I now get colours mostly working
b4e3daec418edfcea395a7f72f63a812 (04:06): but when setting the colours for vertsplit they only seem to work when cterm=bold (and then only the color < 8 ? color + 8 | color is used)
b4e3daec418edfcea395a7f72f63a812 (04:07): it also happens with StatusLine
fca2fab4a7479513eb5b2990a79704d3 (04:08): can help, i use gvim
b4e3daec418edfcea395a7f72f63a812 (04:11): well this is not gvim it is just plain vim
fca2fab4a7479513eb5b2990a79704d3 (04:18): i hated the struggle with the term settings, and i like nice fonts when i work, so eventually i switched to gvim
b4e3daec418edfcea395a7f72f63a812 (04:20): well it is workable now - just nice to know if it is bugged there or if there is some fix
b4e3daec418edfcea395a7f72f63a812 (04:20): I like my aesthetics simple, but functional
